meanings.definition: A subdued or muted tone or quality in music or speech.
meanings.sent1: The singer's voice had a soft undertone that added depth to the song.
meanings.sent2: There was an undertone of sadness in her voice as she spoke about her lost pet.
meanings.sent3: The undertone of the music made the audience feel relaxed and peaceful.
meanings.sent4: His speech had an undertone of authority that commanded attention from the audience.
meanings.sent5: The undertone of the painting gave it a mysterious and intriguing vibe.

meanings.definition: An underlying or implicit meaning or quality.
meanings.sent1: The movie had an undertone of hope despite its dark themes.
meanings.sent2: There was an undertone of sarcasm in her words that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The undertone of the joke was cleverly hidden until the punchline.
meanings.sent4: His smile had an undertone of mischief that hinted at his playful nature.
meanings.sent5: The undertone of the story left a lasting impact on the audience.
meanings.sent6: The undertone of the conversation revealed their true feelings about the situation.
